Load the worldcities.csv file into a DataFrame.
Filter the rows where longitude (lng) is negative to keep cities in the Western Hemisphere.
Further filter those rows where latitude (lat) is negative to keep only cities that are simultaneously in the Southern Hemisphere.
Find the maximum value in the population column within this doubly-filtered set.
Select the row(s) whose population equals that maximum value (i.e., the most populous city in both hemispheres).
